Information: It has potential Ayurvedic uses Anti-inflammatory Properties,Antioxidant Effects,,Digestive Support,Pain Relief,Immune Support, andAntimicrobial Properties
Procedure:
Preparation:Harvest fresh chakte leaves from the plant. Ensure they are clean and free from any signs of damage or disease.

Wash the leaves thoroughly under running water to remove any dirt or impurities.

Internal Consumption:Prepare a decoction by boiling a handful of chakte leaves in water until the water reduces to about half its original volume.

Strain the liquid to remove the leaves, leaving behind the decoction.Drink the cooled decoction as a beverage.
 
Consuming it regularly may provide various health benefits, including anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects, digestive support, pain relief, and immune support.

Topical Application:Crush fresh chakte leaves to extract their juice or make a paste.

Apply the juice or paste directly to the affected area for localized pain relief or to promote healing of skin conditions,

The anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial, and pain-relieving properties of chakte leaves may help alleviate discomfort and promote healing when applied topically.
